metadata.title: CVE-2022-42895 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
There is an infoleak vulnerability in the Linux kernel'snet/bluetooth/l2cap_core.c's l2cap_parse_conf_req function which can beused to leak kernel pointers remotely. We recommend upgrading past commithttps://github.com/torvalds/linux/commit/b1a2cd50c0357f243b7435a732b4e62ba3157a2ehttps://www.google.com/url

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-42895` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

No subscription required
